content.question: During a La Niña event, what environmental changes would the tropical Pacific Ocean and its surrounding landmasses most likely experience?

choices.label: Increased rainfall in the eastern Pacific Ocean leading to flooding and landslides off the coast of South America
An area of high pressure forming over landmasses and increasing the chance of typhoons
Cooler ocean water in the western Pacific Ocean leading to an increased chance of wildfires
Increased upwelling off the coast of South America resulting in increased productivity of fisheries

content.answer: Increased upwelling off the coast of South America resulting in increased productivity of fisheries
